column1: A termite walks into a bar and asks is the bartender here?
column3: In this context, bar can mean a place that serves alcoholic drinks or a physical barrier.
column4: The new bar in the downtown area has become a popular spot for socializing.
column5: The athlete was unable to pass the high jump bar set at six feet.

column1: Why did the farmer put brandy in the cows food? he wanted to raised stewed beef!
column3: Raised can mean to lift something up or can refer to the act of bringing up animals for food.
column4: The worker raised the flag to signal the end of the day.
column5: The farmer raised cattle on his ranch to sell at the market.

column1: What do you call someone who points out the obvious? someone who points out the obvious.
column3: In this context, points can refer to the action of indicating or directing attention to something, or it can refer to the score in a game.
column4: During the presentation, he points to various graphs to illustrate his points.
column5: The team scored several points during the last quarter of the game.
